intro: Cyanea humilis, commonly known as the low cyanea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This species is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cyanea humilis is considered a rare and endangered species.
